Post.title: Aerospike-
Post.author: Liao Jiayi
Post._content:
Aerospike[Aerospike](https://discuss.aerospike.com/t/device-overload-when-map-size-is-too-big/5206)Aerospike

#### Storage Layout
![Storage Layout][1]
SSD namespace***MapOperation.PUT***  
1. **MapOperation.PUT**Metadatanamespacesetblock5  
2. block1024bytesblockfullblockWrite Queue  
3. workerWrite QueueSSD  
4. memorystoragehwm(high-watermark-memory)evict[ttleviction](https://discuss.aerospike.com/t/records-ttl-and-evictions-for-aerospike-server-version-prior-to-3-8/737)  
5. blockblockusage level100%defrag-lwm-pct50%defragblockwrite queue  

***
#### Potential Risk
[Aerospike](https://www.aerospike.com/docs/reference/configuration#write-block-size)
* Recordblockrecord size >  write-block-sizewrite-block-sizenamespacewrite-block-sizeusage-leveldefragSSDflush
* Blockwrite-queuequeue "write fail: queue too deep: exceeds max %i"queuemax-write-cache queue length = max-write-cache / write-block-size
* RecordUPDATE/DELETE/PUTRecordbig recordqueue too deep
* UPDATE/DELETE/PUTblock usage leveldefragdefragdefraglow-water-markdefragdefrag-lwm-pct
* evicthigh-water-memory-pcthigh-water-dist-pctevict

***
#### Log Inspection
LogasLoglog level info 
```
{test} /dev/xvdc: used-bytes 3695468032 free-wblocks 34690 write-q 0 write (445674,0.0) defrag-q 0 defrag-read (39134,0.0) defrag-write (5427,0.0)
```
asoutputnamespace test/dev/xvdcSSD3695468032 bytesfree-wblocks34690write-queue0445674(defrag)blocks0.0defrag-queue0defrag 39134blocks0.0defragblock54270.0
```
{test} breached eviction hwm (memory), memory sz:1792174976 (1792174976 + 0) hwm:1288490188, disk sz:3695922432 hwm:20128464896
no records below eviction void-time 266233878 - threshold bucket 4678, width 113 sec, count 298 > target 11 (0.5 pct)
```
log[asevict](https://discuss.aerospike.com/t/records-ttl-and-evictions-for-aerospike-server-version-prior-to-3-8/737)sizehwmevictioncount 298 > target 11bucketevictevict11bucket298
































[1]: http://liaojiayi.com/assets/aerospike0.png

AerospikeAerospikeAerospike

Storage Layout


SSD namespaceMapOperation.PUT

  1. MapOperation.PUTMetadatanamespacesetblock5
  2. block1024bytesblockfullblockWrite Queue
  3. workerWrite QueueSSD
  4. memorystoragehwm(high-watermark-memory)evictttleviction
  5. blockblockusage level100%defrag-lwm-pct50%defragblockwrite queue

Potential Risk

Aerospike

  • Recordblockrecord size > write-block-sizewrite-block-sizenamespacewrite-block-sizeusage-leveldefragSSDflush
  • Blockwrite-queuequeue write fail: queue too deep: exceeds max %iqueuemax-write-cache queue length = max-write-cache / write-block-size
  • RecordUPDATE/DELETE/PUTRecordbig recordqueue too deep
  • UPDATE/DELETE/PUTblock usage leveldefragdefragdefraglow-water-markdefragdefrag-lwm-pct
  • evicthigh-water-memory-pcthigh-water-dist-pctevict

Log Inspection

Post.title: Aerospike
Post._content:
### 
 
   
*     
*    
*    

redisCassandra     
Aerospike2012KV4.06Aerospike

***

### 
AerospikeData modelHbasenamespace/table/row/column family   
 
* **namespace**
    - namespace    
    - DRAMSSD
    - replicanamespace
    - expire TTL
* **sets**
    - setssetsetset
* **records**
    - record:
        * key
        * metadata((version), ttl, last-update-time(lut))
        * bins
* **bins**
    - namevalue

***
### 
Aerospike

* **Primary-Index**
    - Primary-IndexAerospike[](https://www.aerospike.com/docs/architecture/primary-index.html)keyhash12bitpartitionIDpartition4096
* **Secondary-Index**
    - Secondary-IndexbinpartitionIdscanpartition listSecondary-IndexAerospikelow load

***
### 
namespaceAerospike41024partitionreplica1[](https://www.aerospike.com/docs/architecture/consistency.html)

1. replicareplicamasterreplica
2. partitionreplicamaster
3. indexscanSSDrebalancepartitionready

***
### 
KVSpeedScaleAerospike

* MongoDBRedisScale
* Couchbaseudf
* Cassandra

***
### 
Aerospike

* Aerospike Rolling StartscanSSD
* hyperloglog
* record1MB
* rebalance

Post.title: Bitmap
Post.author: Liao Jiayi
Post.content:
PaperAn Experimental Study of Bitmap Compression vs.
Inverted List Compression
BitmapBitmapPaper

History

BitmapRoaringBitmapRoaring

WAH(Word Aligned Hybrid)

01groupbits31bit32bit

EWAH(Enhanced Word Aligned Hybrid)

WAHHeaderHeader

CONCISE(Compressed N Composble Integer Set)

WAHWAHbit1groupodd bitodd bit

VALWAH(Variable-Aligned Length WAH)

WAHgroup32bit32bit2^31 - 1groupbitmap

Roaring

65535bitbucketbucketinteger16bitbucketbucket[0 ~ 65535]16bit0bucket[65536 ~ 65536*2 - 1]16bit165536short integer(16bit)integer16bitbucketinteger > 4096

RoaringBitmap

RoaringBitmap:HighLowContainerInteger16bitkeysContainerContainerContainerAddContainer

binarySearchindex

ArrayContainer

  • content: short(16bitHighLowContainer16bitshort)
  • DEFAULT_MAX_SIZE: 4096BitmapContainer

add

  1. xcontent
  2. cardinalityContainer
  3. contentloccontent

BitmapContainer

  • bitmap: 1Container65536(2^16bit)IntegerBitmapContainerlong(2^6bit)long

add:

  1. x/64bitmaplongprevious
  2. previous | (1L << x) newval
  3. cardinality
    Integerlong1runOptimizeRunContainer

RunContainer

Post.title: FlinkExactly-Once
Post.author: Liao Jiayi
Post._content:
[Official Document](https://flink.apache.org/features/2018/03/01/end-to-end-exactly-once-apache-flink.html)
### 
Spark2.3BetaSparkStructure StreamingFlinkFlink...
***
### 
Exactly-onceExactly-onceProcessExactly-onceExactly-onceEnd-to-end
***
### Exacly-once
Exactly-onceFlink**TwoPhaseCommitSinkFunction**[JIRA](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FLINK-7210)[PR](https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/4368)
CheckpointPhase()

1. preCommit()
2. commit()

#### preCommit()    
![flink-precommit][1]  
kafkaWindowFunctionkafkaCheckpointDatasourcebarriersnapshotsnapshotSinkPre-commit()TaskmanagerSinkcommit()

**committaskmanagercommit**

#### commit()   
![flink-commit][2]  
checkpointJobManagerListenerCallback**SinkJobManagercheckpointCompletedcommit**commit

*** 
### 
Exactly-onceHivetarget directory

**4**
* beginTransaction - 
* preCommit - commitflush
* commit - 
* abort -

[2]: http://liaojiayi.com/assets/flink-3.png

Post.title: hs_err_pid.log
Post.author: Liao Jiayi
Post._content:
{% codeblock %}
# There is insufficient memory for the Java Runtime Environment to continue.
# Native memory allocation (mmap) failed to map 12288 bytes for committing reserved memory.
# Possible reasons:
#   The system is out of physical RAM or swap space
#   In 32 bit mode, the process size limit was hit
# Possible solutions:
#   Reduce memory load on the system
#   Increase physical memory or swap space
#   Check if swap backing store is full
#   Use 64 bit Java on a 64 bit OS
#   Decrease Java heap size (-Xmx/-Xms)
#   Decrease number of Java threads
#   Decrease Java thread stack sizes (-Xss)
#   Set larger code cache with -XX:ReservedCodeCacheSize=
# This output file may be truncated or incomplete.
#
#  Out of Memory Error (os_linux.cpp:2673), pid=13016, tid=140682742126336
#
# JRE version: Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (8.0_40-b25) (build 1.8.0_40-b25)
# Java VM: Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (25.40-b25 mixed mode linux-amd64 compressed oops)
# Failed to write core dump. Core dumps have been disabled. To enable core dumping, try "ulimit -c unlimited" before starting Java again
{% endcodeblock %}


crashsolution

Current thread (0x00007ff2d8001000):  JavaThread "flink-akka.remote.default-remote-dispatcher-15" daemon [_thread_new, id=31925, stack(0x00007ff340ced000,0x00007ff340dee000)]

Native frames: (J=compiled Java code, j=interpreted, Vv=VM code, C=native code)

V  [libjvm.so+0x4f333b]  report_vm_out_of_memory(char const*, int, unsigned long, VMErrorType, char const*)+0x8b
V  [libjvm.so+0x90e8c3]  os::Linux::commit_memory_impl(char*, unsigned long, bool)+0x103
V  [libjvm.so+0x90e98c]  os::pd_commit_memory(char*, unsigned long, bool)+0xc
V  [libjvm.so+0x90772a]  os::commit_memory(char*, unsigned long, bool)+0x2a
V  [libjvm.so+0x90c97f]  os::pd_create_stack_guard_pages(char*, unsigned long)+0x7f

C  [libpthread.so.0+0x7dc5]  start_thread+0xc5

Current Threadcrash
****: JavaThread
* JavaThread
* VMThreadVMGC
* CompilerThread
* GCTaskThread
* WatcherThread
* ConcurrentMarkSweepThread

****_thread_new

 | 
- | -
 _thread_uninitialized | 
 _thread_new | 
 _thread_in_native | native code
 _thread_in_vm | VMcode
 _thread_in_java | javacode
 _thread_blocked | block
